intro: Chrysosplenium macrostemon var. atrandrum, commonly known as the black-veined chrysosplenium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Saxifragaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
